title: @RiotScruffy Is the Yorick Rework Still a Thing?
body:
In this thread http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=3605329 Xelnath outlined a yorick rework that looked pretty darn sick, and said it would be handed over to you. It's been almost two years, I was wondering if we could get an update on this, even just to say that it's iceboxed, or something. Yorick seems like he'd be a priority because his playstyle is oppressive, resulting in him being pretty weak and binary (win the lane, lose the game). He also seems like he fits the "Juggernaut" fantasy really well (low mobility, high dueling/damage capacity with tankiness). So... can you tell us anything?

Upvote and bump for yorick attention. I'm sure I'm not the only one who wants to see him rise from the dead.

replies.body:
The Yorick rework Xelnath was experimenting with did get ice boxed. We do plan to do a full rework (Sion/Poppy level) for Yorick still at some point, at the very least that won't be happening this year though. Yorick's got some major issues, Poppy, and likely Taric, are ahead of him in the full relaunch queue at a minimum though. 

In terms of class we do think juggernaut would be a good fit. Given his minion summoning theme the direction we're most likely to go is a juggernaut with strong pushing power (split push, counter push, tower sieger or some combination of the above).

I see Taric as being more playable, at the very least far simpler. Support Taric has to be one of the easiest Tank Supports to play: targeted heal, point and click stun, passive armor buff that requires zero thought, and a generic Make-ADC-Better ult. Basically is think what he meant by "playable" is that in like a ranked game you would rather have a Yorick top than a Taric support.

While I do believe Taric needs a rework, I don't think we should always compare champion kits based on the current meta.  The meta seems to change too quickly for that to be a fair comparison.

Olaf can be the counter-engage Berseker juggernaut, (if the enemy team start the fight with a strong CC, he can free and "counter-engage" so he need to be strong agains hard engage) he need to be the champ that turn more strong when is near to dead (Malmortius and Sterak can be now some of his main items), these two characteristics need to be his main "strenghtness": anti-cc and berseker. And in the "weakness" department he has: is very kitteable, and don't have AoE, low mobility etc. So Riot need to make more stronger and weaker his  "strenghtness" and "weakness", and also give him more "uniquess" in his kit, some things that make him feel more like a Berseker, for example that gains "X" stats when enters in a fight and increase with the duration of Olaf in fight, because he loves fight, and also turn more and more stronger when he is fighting and is very nearly to death too. A new passive that give him stats depend of the amount of time that he is in a fight. Now I think that his E turn more stronger when he is weak (missing health part damage portion). and with these two changes he make more clearly his identity, move his actual passive to his W, and remove the atk spd steroid on his kit. So he keeps Strong 1 vs 1 but weak in AoE fights, have a solid counter-engage juggernaut thematic. 

Shyvanna has more problems in the "uniquess" of her kit,  because jas a low mobility but she is good in a lot of things and not have a real wealness right now, so Riot need to do somthing that make her feel moew unique and offer to the game, new things.

I'll play Devil's advocate in this case.  I've heard Riot's argument enough to recite it from memory.

Yorick's on the "We will be reworking this champion" list.  Before that, he was on the "We don't want to promote him at all for the good of the game (and we absolutely hate him)" list.

What if the skins team were to release a new Yorick skin that you bought and loved (for instance, Winter Wonder Yorick with a snow shovel and Poro-Ghouls).  Then, when the rework comes, Riot pulls a "Trundle" and completely changes Yorick from the "hulking, undead green gravedigger" to the "generically overused fantasy necromancer cliche" champ?  You'd get upset, you'd get rightfully upset, and all Riot can do is just give you the finger and say "we think this is a better Yorick for the game."  (re: Trundle).

There's also the whole "we don't want to give the rework team additional work," excuse they use (which didn't stop them from making skins for Eve, Morde and Zilean...)

So, yeah... while Yorick could _realistically_ see a rework release of 2017 and a new skin by 2018, there will be no love for the Grave Digger until then.

Ive been playing yorick since his release, i might have over 5000 games played with him over the years. (way more than that.) Mianly because i ddint enjoy being a part of playing the champions that have dashes, or built in armor pen, or attack speed steroids, or ridiculous amounts of cc. His actual main issue is that he has no hard cc. other champions that do seem to have a higher win rate because locking down an individual and doing that over and over seems to work well. Teams that revolve around this have the best teamfights as well. lokcing down your opponent and making sure they cant move or cast spells over the course of 2 seconds, with a gank from a jungler that has good cc (Vi,  Udyr) just stack the stun right after the other has worn off and you have yourself a flash or a garunteed FB. Yoricks biggest weakness is solo queue because so many people forget his Zombie Form ULT and often run away or just sit there. its best if you just ult the adc or yourself and benifit from unholy covenants bonus for a much longer duration. Take attention from the enemy team, cast your skills and draw them into your team. If your team is smart enough or nice enough or arent cowardly they should SEE that you just took most of the enemies cooldowns and can counter attack. Like alistar Gaining about 20% dmg reduction with all minions including revenant, you should come out fine healing and with a boost of speed from your kit. find a nearby minion/jungle monster cast e heal and get back in the fight. They buffed him a bit by giving him a little range for his q which makes a ghoul shower combo easier to get off and the attack reset has never felt better.
